data.title: 'Super/Man' documentary on Christopher Reeve's life creates social media buzz after Sundance premiere
data.meta_description: Super/Man, a new documentary film which is based on the late actor Christopher Reeve, is making rounds on social media. Here's everything to know more
data.text:
Synopsis

Super/Man, a new documentary film which is based on the late actor Christopher Reeve, is making rounds on social media. Here's everything to know more

A new documentary film titled 'Super/Man' based on Christopher Reeve, the actor who is famous for the role he played in Superman, the 1978 film has taken social media by storm for its intimate and raw look into the life of the late actor.

The film which is directed by Peter Ettedgui and Ian Bonhôte, documenting the life of Reeve made its debut at the Sundance Film Festival 40th edition in Park City, Utah. The film left the audiences in applause, tears, and laudation as per The Guardian.

Super/Man: The Christopher Reeve Story: What is it about?

Super/Man: The Christopher Reeve Story follows the life of the famous actor before and following a horse-riding incident that left him in permanent paralysis from his neck down, as per the Sundance Film Festival.

The film includes the actor's footage and his family in their videos at home and interviews with the three children of Reeve along with his fellow actors. Reeve has made the narration for the majority of the film with his words transported from both the audiobook versions of his accounts as per The Guardian.

Super/Man is exploring the friendship of Reeve with Robin Williams, an actor with whom he has gone to The Juilliard School in New York, sharing a close bond.

Christopher Reeve: What happened to him?

Reeve was involved in a deadly horse riding accident in the year 1995 leaving him disabled from neck down. Reeve has undertaken philanthropy after his accident, becoming an activist for the treatment of spinal cord injury and rights for disability.

Christopher Reeve: When did he die?

Christopher Reeve died on October 12, 2024, because of cardiac arrest at 52 years of age. Post being wheelchair-bound for several years, he has developed a pressure wound, which is a common difficulty for people who are in wheelchairs.

The wound turned out to be extremely infected with the infection spreading through the body shoving the actor into a coma, post which he went through heart failure and eventually passed away as per a New York Times report in 2004.

Super/Man: Where to watch it?

It might be some time till one gets the opportunity to watch Super/Man since the movies that were being screened at the film festivals were displayed in the expectations of making the sales of a movie through a studio for distributing it.

For instance, the global rights for "It's What's Inside" the thriller by Greg Jardin, were purchased by Netflix. The movie was also screened at the Sundance Film Festival for approximately $17 million, as per a report in The Hollywood Reporter.

The makers of Super/Man have not yet unveiled if they are discussing the future of the film with any distributors.

FAQs:

Which documentary film has taken social media by storm?

A new documentary film titled 'Super/Man' based on Christopher Reeve, the actor who is famous for the role he played in Superman, the 1978 film has taken social media by storm for its intimate and raw look into the life of the late actor.

What is Super/Man about?

Super/Man: The Christopher Reeve Story follows the life of the famous actor before and following a horse-riding incident that left him in permanent paralysis from his neck down, as per the Sundance Film Festival.
